record.description: Members of an expedition led by Dr. Kenneth S. Sandford and William J. Arkell, British geologists of Oxford University working with the University of Chicago. The two scientists have sought and discovered, for nearly a thousand miles up and down the Nile, evidence of the oldest Egyptians, and this important expedition has been able to fill in many scenes in the prehistoric panorama.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: News clipping attached to the back. Also says on back "from Science Service, courtesy of the Oriental Institute."
